title.narrative: F.a: Strengthening community based seeds systems to defend their seed rights

description.narrative: The project entails discussions between two members of the international small scale farmer movement, Via Campesina, namely Zimbabwean ZIMSOFF and Mozambican UNAC, on their coordination responsibilities on regional and international levels. They will draft a strategy to support the peasant struggle in Eastern and Southern Africa. They will organize exchange visits between their memberships in order to identify good practices of community based seed systems. Videos and written material will be produced on th ese practices and shared among farmers. ZIMSOFF and UNAC will also organize a workshop on the implications of harmonizing Southern and Eastern African seed laws to community based seed systems in order to strengthen the peasant voice in the theme. The proj ect aims to develop a pilot programme between ZIMSOFF and UNAC on strengthening community based, farmer lead seed systems. In addition, it contributes to the establishment of a strong regional farmers’ seed network.The dominant position of multinational corporations in management of the basic means of agricultural production is one of Southern Africa’s biggest challenges. Seeds are also within the radar of corporate control, as COMESA (Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa) and SADC (Southern Af rica Development Community) are planning to harmonize seed laws. This would imply dominance of commercial, genetically modified seeds over community managed native seeds, and criminalization of their use. Through the project, ZIMSOFF aims to defend peasant s’ basic right to save, exchange, evolve, breed and sell seeds and maintain their diversity.
